snippet: An executive with Match Services, the company contracted by FIFA to sell match tickets and hospitality packages, apparently evaded police trying to serve him with an arrest warrant.
abstract: Ray Whelan, suspect in police investigation into illegal ticket-selling scheme at the World Cup, slips out of luxurious Rio de Janeiro hotel only moments before police arrived to arrest him; Whelan, who had been arrested and released after habeas corpus request, is an executive with Match Services, company contracted by FIFA to sell tickets and hospitality packages.
lead_paragraph: An executive with Match Services, the company contracted by FIFA to sell match tickets and hospitality packages, apparently evaded police trying to serve him with an arrest warrant.

headline.main: World Cup 2014: Executive Is Called Fugitive in Ticket-Selling Case
headline.print_headline: Suspect Is Called Fugitive in Ticket Case
